favorites.title: El Mal Querer
favorites.author: ROSAL√çA
favorites.review: El Mal Querer was my first time listening to a mix of flamenco & r&b & electronic and I was blown away by how the styles of music compliment each other. Also, amazing interpolation of JT's "Cry Me a River".

favorites.author: Against All Logic
favorites.review: I can't sing this album's praise enough. The skillful sampling, the combo of dance/funk rhythms, and the color emitted from this positive album is wild and intoxicating.

favorites.title: Superorganism
favorites.author: Superorganism
favorites.review: Insanely fun, silly, and energetic album! Very strong The Flaming Lips vibe. Got to see them at Primavera Sound this year and it was a blast. ‚ò∫Ô∏è

favorites.title: Knock Knock
favorites.author: DJ Koze
favorites.review: Another artist I saw at Primavera. Koze started his wholesome set with 'You & Me' by Penny and the Quarters. On this album, Koze has perfected his warm and minimal approach to techno, while reminding us of his love for music. "I live music and I speak music. Music on my Teeth!"

favorites.title: Veteran
favorites.author: JPEGMAFIA
favorites.review: "Daaaaaam Peggy." Got to see JPEG this year in Chapel Hill w/ Milo & Euclid. The energy in his music is probably 1/5 of the energy that he gives at his shows. Favorite experimental hip-hop album of the year.

favorites.title: Be the Cowboy
favorites.author: Mitski
favorites.review: Iggy Pop said it best, "[Mitski's] the most advanced American songwriter that I know". It's honestly bonkers how good this album is. Mitski skillfully delivers.

favorites.title: Whack World
favorites.author: Tierra Whack
favorites.review: 15 minutes, 15 songs, giving a small glimpse into the endlessly creative world of Tierra Whack. Just go watch the music video, you'll see what I mean.

favorites.title: Some Rap Songs
favorites.author: Earl Sweatshirt
favorites.review: I find the title of this album to be ironic, because these tracks don't feel like rap songs as much as they feel like a natural extension of Earl's mind. Earl's flow is dangerously fluid while he vibes to these warbly Madlib inspired beats! üíï

favorites.title: Negro Swan
favorites.author: Blood Orange
favorites.review: Negro Swan is such a smooth and easy listen. Overall, a well-balanced album that I keep returning to, and has some of my favorite tracks of this year (Saint, Hope, Smoke). Thank you Dev! üôåüèΩ

favorites.title: Daytona
favorites.author: Pusha T
favorites.review: Aside from sparking one of the best rap-feuds of the year, on this instant-classic, Push teaches a master-level class on flow, and mercilessness.

favorites.title: Room 25
favorites.author: Noname
favorites.review: Major stan of her previous project, Telefone. On this album, Noname's production and song-writing have leveled up entirely, all while retaining her poetic and soulful essence.
